m_szDocSumamry: textArticle -------------------- What goes up, must go up forever? Tuesday, August 28, 2012       Follow @OilVoice Follow @OilVoice   There appears to be a prevailing market belief that commodity prices can only rise in the long-term, despite short-term fluctuations. Inelastic demand from developed countries and unremitting demand growth from emerging markets are the most commonly cited reasons for this. As a result, investors are putting companies in this space on a pedestal, taking recent earnings growth of such firms for granted. Value investors must be careful not to get caught up in this
